body_html:
@tatatodd I am using Windows 10 x64 bit version and I am trying to install the tensorflow version available on the tensorflow website. I am using "pip3 install --upgrade tensorflow-gpu" command for installing tensorflow gpu version,I am using python version "Python 3.6.3 (v3.6.3:2c5fed8, Oct 3 2017, 17:26:49) [MSC v.1900 32 bit (Intel)] on win32
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information."
I installed CUDA 9.0 from NVDIA and also added cuDNN's dll to the respectivefolders as said in the installation guide. I also have numpy, dev,pip and wheel installed .After this when I try to run the command "pip3 install --upgrade tensorflow-gpu" the error

pip3 install --upgrade tensorflow-gpu
Collecting tensorflow-gpu
Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement tensorflow-gpu (from versions: )
No matching distribution found for tensorflow-gpu
comes up. please help

body:
@tatatodd I am using Windows 10 x64 bit version and I am trying to install the tensorflow version available on the tensorflow website. I am using "pip3 install --upgrade tensorflow-gpu" command for installing tensorflow gpu version,I am using python version "Python 3.6.3 (v3.6.3:2c5fed8, Oct  3 2017, 17:26:49) [MSC v.1900 32 bit (Intel)] on win32
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information."
 I installed CUDA 9.0 from NVDIA and also added cuDNN's dll to the respectivefolders as said in the installation guide. I also have numpy, dev,pip and wheel installed .After this when I try to run the command "pip3 install --upgrade tensorflow-gpu" the error

pip3 install --upgrade tensorflow-gpu
Collecting tensorflow-gpu
  Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement tensorflow-gpu (from versions: )
No matching distribution found for tensorflow-gpu
 comes up. please help
